intro: Aylostera melanocentra, commonly known as the black-centred aylostera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Aylostera melanocentra is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
